post_text: SPECIAL VISITOR: Pre-K 3 & Pre-K 4 Teacher, Melinda Cortinas, from Lotspeich Elementary was 'caught in the act' while she was conducting weekly home visits with her 14 students. Mrs. Cortinas said she does this because she wants to "not just be a face on the screen, but to see them in person to build connections with her students." Mrs. Cortinas feels that this special connection will make the transition easier when students return for face-to-face instruction. She also gave her students a special gift that included a name puzzle, a writing map, play-doh, and school supplies. Way to go, Mrs. Cortinas! Your demonstration of passion for teaching shines through and through! #RobstownProud #StrongerTogether

post_text: Summer School Academy has come to an end today. Our students have successfully completed the program and have gained wonderful memories that will last a lifetime and knowledge that will prepare them for their next school year with Robstown ISD. Summer activities were themed around the movie and book, CoCo. Students really enjoyed reading the book as part of RISD’s Literacy Summer School component. Thank you for such a special day, Diana Lopez! #RobstownProud
